snippet.textDisplay:
I think they were both toxic yesss. I don’t like when people put Johnny on this god like pedestal…like he’s an angle or something. Cause that’s not true. But it is complicated because lots of his behavior can be explained in a way. Like him leaving during a fight…if I’m getting hit I’m leaving too. But that doesn’t mean he could of left in a healthier way. I’m positive…although I technically don’t know for sure..but I think he said mean stuff to her and did toxic things. It was a bad relationship. They were equally bad for each other. BUT that being said…I think people tend to look into this case a little bit and take the easy explanation and say “they were both abusive”. Not true. Trust me that’s what I thought to…but it’s not that simple. It is possible for a man to be the victim without also being abusive. I’ve done…probably to much research on this case and after YEARS of research. Johnny was not abusive. There’s not much more to say. There is no evidence he ever was. I could sit here and type ever reason why he wasn’t abusive…but that would take forever lol. If anyone has arguments or questions I’ll answer but unless amber give fool proof evidence I won’t believe her. And yes amber abused him.

OK SO to wrap things up…they were both toxic…but they weren’t both abusive.

snippet.textDisplay: Um…I do get there can be some things wrong with dating older guys but…that doesn’t necessarily mean it was all bad or Johnny was trying to manipulate them. I think Johnny and Kate were a lot more toxic tho. But Johnny was just as fucked up for years after being with Winona. Doesn’t mean she was a bad person. I just think they were in love. Right person wrong time she was too young and he was to young especially for them to get married. Idk and Kate has always done drugs…so has Johnny. That’s just them lol.

snippet.textDisplay: I know I'm a little late to this camp, but I've read the draft trial document ruled by Judge Nicol for the Johnny Depp vs The Sun case, and I suggest everyone read it too so as to get a balanced viewpoint instead of listening to rumors from those who are already biased for Johnny Depp. He is the abuser! All the text messages that he sent to the people around him were quoted in verbatim, and it shows a very disordered personality. The language he used, the complete mood swing from loving her and calling her his savior from his drug addiction to saying that he will burn and drown her and fuck her dead corpse. Also, the amount of boot-licking and enabling from the people around him, especially his staff, is just revolting. Amber, not sure if she's exactly innocent in this, shows a more stable personality through the messages that she sent to her sister, mother and she even wrote diary entries to herself talking about Johnny Depp. In the end, 12 out of 14 incidents where he attacked her were ruled by the judge to have occurred and the evidence presented was overwhelming, so it's appalling that everyone is calling Johnny Depp the victim here.

snippet.textDisplay: There's a crucial difference: not the low level self centered, but the passive and agressive narcissist identify with the villain; normal people identify with the hero. To the narcissist, the hero is weak and vanilla and self-righteous.  They hate people either because they feel they will never compare or be as good; or because they are psychopaths and non empathetic.
snippet.textOriginal: There's a crucial difference: not the low level self centered, but the passive and agressive narcissist identify with the villain; normal people identify with the hero. snippet.textDisplay: Believe it or not Johnny was also toxic. A man with such serious substance abuse issues who literally romanticizes drug use and repeatedly refuses to seek treatment and sober up IS toxic. Have you guys heard the tape where he literally asks her to cut him? If that isn't toxic and scary, idk what is. He's also the archetype of midlife crisis who dumped his longtime partner for a random c list actress, so stop referring to him as some sort of sweet cinnamon angel who can do no wrong. Shallon is right, they're both terrible trainwrecks, period.

snippet.textDisplay:
@Margarita If you read some interviews it is obvious that his relationship with drugs is a very complex one. Specifically the Lawrence Krauss interview where he speaks almost appreciatively of drugs. And based on the tapes he sounds like someone who doesn’t even believe he has a drug problem when he clearly does. I’ve followed Johnny for more than 8 years so believe me I know that he’s been using since he was a teenager. He’s probably tried to cut down on it (and I believe he was sober while he was with Vanessa Paradis) but detox/intervention isn’t rehab.
Depressed people can be toxic. Believe it or not there’s a thing called emotional manipulation and that’s exactly what he does in the “cut me” tape. I don’t even want to defend AH because she’s just as messed up but Johnny certainly isn’t blameless. Just two very fucked up people who unfortunately found each other. I hope Johnny gets the help he really needs.

snippet.textDisplay:
When did he romanticize drug use? How do you know that he refuses to seek treatment? Did he tell you?
On that "cut me" audio he sounds so depressed and devastated. Wanting to hurt himself doesn’t make him a wife beater or toxic person. Being toxic is being poisonous to people around you, as I undestand it. Did he ask her to cut HERself? No. Did he cut her? No. The fact that he was (is?) so depressed and tired and in pain is indeed scary. That is what she had done to him, like all abusers do to their victims.
